Although Beckstoffer Vineyards, the largest private grower in California, had recently set a sales record with a blockbuster harvest of $55 million worth of cabernet sauvignon, its founder was not in the mood to celebrate. The wine industry was in trouble, facing its worst outlook in generations  and that was before the coronavirus struck.

title: Make Ice Cream, in a Mason Jar
description: Making ice cream at home feels like alchemy, a complex process of mixing and cooling.

title: Will the Coronavirus Crisis Trump the Climate Crisis?
description: BRUSSELS  With the global paralysis induced by the coronavirus, levels of pollution and carbon emission are dropping everywhere  leaving bluer skies, visible mountains, splendid wildflowers. Even Venices famously murky canals are running clear.

title: These Are the Things That New Yorkers Achingly Miss
description: To hop on the train, any train, earbuds intact, alone in the crowd on the way somewhere else. To walk out of the Metropolitan Museum of Art, exhausted as if from a march. The sweet-potato fries and a beer at Tubby Hook Tavern in Inwood; the coffee-cart guy on West 40th Street who remembers you take it black.

title: How 5 Friends Helped a Tulip Farm Make It to Mothers Day
description: MOUNT VERNON, Wash.  When the Mount Vernon High School Bulldogs faced off against their basketball rivals a generation ago, five friends from the class of 1994 were the spark plugs, game after game. Three were on the cheer squad, stoking school spirit; two were on court, scoring points.

title: Anxious About the Virus, Older Voters Grow More Wary of Trump
Nightly Applause Is Nice, but Some Doctors Think Votes Would Be Nicer
description: Maxine Dexter, an intensive care physician, remembers exactly where she was sitting the Thursday morning her political ambitions were born. She was looking out her bedroom window toward northwest Portland  the snow-capped peak of Mount Adams winking at her from across the valley. She clutched a coffee her husband had brought upstairs in her favorite mug, the one that read: Well yes, Im overqualified.

title: Sister Fights to Free Uighur Businessman Held in China After U.S. Trip
description: WASHINGTON  When Ekpar Asat saw his older sister for the last time one winter night in Manhattan, he promised her he would return to the United States in a few months with their parents to watch her graduate with a masters degree from Harvard Law School  the first ethnic Uighur to do so.

title: Taiwans Weapon Against Coronavirus: An Epidemiologist as Vice President
description: TAIPEI, Taiwan  The calls come at night, when Taiwans vice president, Chen Chien-jen, is usually at home in his pajamas. Scientists seek his advice on the development of antiviral medications. Health officials ask for guidance as they investigate an outbreak of the coronavirus on a navy ship.

title: Sparks Flew Before the Curtain Call
description: Lindsay Murphy was trying to become a better writer when she joined an online message forum on that subject in January 2017, and encountered Julianne Miller, who had already clicked into the forum to pick up a few writing tips.

title: It was an On-Time Proposal
description: Peter Harrison knew the newly opened TWA hotel at Kennedy Airport in Queens was just the place to propose to Jennifer Markas.

title: A Big Fat Greek Wedding Will Have to Wait
description: When John Damianoss cellphone began buzzing on the Dartmouth campus in September 2015, he realized he was being FaceTimed by Vungelia Glyptis, a fellow student whom he had not talked to in two years.

title: A Groom, by Proxy, on Zoom
description: On Friday, April 17, Veronica Wickline, 26, a part-time Latin teacher and writer, stood at the altar at St. Peter, a Roman Catholic church in the foothills of the Blue Ridge Mountains in Little Washington, Va. Dressed in her wedding dress, veil and pearl earrings, she was there to get married. But the man standing next to her was not her beloved groom. Rather, it was his high school best friend, who was serving as a proxy.

title: No Debating Their Love
description: A disagreement about the politics of confrontation was at the heart of the first conversation that Kelly Witwicki Faddegon and Jacy Reese Anthis had when they met, at the beginning of summer in 2014.

title: A New Lease With More Space Than They Needed
description: Renata Certo-Ware and Tristan Graham, both 34, met in 2016, when she and her roommates at the time posted on Craigslist about an extra bedroom in their Philadelphia apartment for sublet.

title: Hospitals Struggle to Restart Lucrative Elective Care After Coronavirus Shutdowns
Breanna Stewarts Comeback Is Going to Take a Little Longer
description: Along with the rest of the world, athletes have had their careers upended by the coronavirus pandemic. They are giving The New York Times an intimate look at their journeys in periodic installments through the rest of the year.

title: U.S. Hits Back at China With New Visa Restrictions on Journalists
description: The Trump administration is imposing new restrictions on Chinese journalists working in the United States, escalating its conflict with China over the news media as the two countries battle for economic, geopolitical and messaging dominance worldwide.

title: Top Health Officials to Quarantine After Being Exposed
description: This briefing has ended. Follow our latest coverage of the coronavirus pandemic.

title: Three Children Have Died in New York of Illness Linked to Virus
description: Three young children have died in New York of a mysterious, toxic-shock inflammation syndrome with links to the coronavirus, Gov. Andrew M. Cuomo said on Saturday.

title: How to Have a Picnic, Safely
description: Its hard to believe that its already May and that were approaching several months of sunny, sweater-less weather. Like flower petals, some states are slowly opening, too, including many once-closed parks, which means itll be hard to resist the urge to picnic.

title: How to Make Your Own Coronavirus Piata (and Then Smash It)
New York City Covid Map and Case Count
description: A detailed ZIP code map shows the extent of the coronavirus outbreak, with charts and tables of the number of cases and deaths.

title: Israel Cracks Down on Banks Over Payments to Palestinian Inmates
description: JERUSALEM  Even as Israel is collaborating with West Bank officials to fight the coronavirus, a new Israeli military order taking effect on Saturday forbids banks in the occupied territory from processing payments that the Palestinian Authority distributes to the families of thousands of Palestinians who have spent time in Israeli jails.

title: The Many Ways Moms Grow
description: Times Insider explains who we are and what we do and delivers behind-the-scenes insights into how our journalism comes together.

title: One-Pot Vegetarian Spicy Red Beans Are #1
description: The weeks most popular dishes include Tejal Raos Punjabi-style red beans with cream or mozzarella (above), Samin Nosrats big lasagna and Melissa Clarks rhubarb custard bars. Find more recipes in the collection below.

title: Little Richard, Flamboyant Wild Man of Rock n Roll, Dies at 87
description: Richard Penniman, better known as Little Richard, who combined the sacred shouts of the black church and the profane sounds of the blues to create some of the worlds first and most influential rock n roll records, died on Saturday in Tullahoma, Tenn. He was 87.

title: Obama Warns That Dropped Charges Against Flynn Put Rule of Law at Risk
description: WASHINGTON  Former President Barack Obama said on Friday that the Justice Departments decision to drop charges against former national security adviser Michael T. Flynn jeopardized the rule of law, adding his voice to the criticism of the extraordinary move.

title: Virus Forces Persian Gulf States to Reckon With Migrant Labor
Variety: Acrostic
description: ACROSTIC  Argh, another difficult acrostic, agreed? If you happen to be here still hoping for hints and no spoilers, remember that Sunday is a holiday and this savage puzzle pays suitably wild homage to those we celebrate. Oh, also, if youre feeling at all fraught today and hope to avoid anything emotionally charged, you might skip the video.

title: My Son Is a Nurse. I Worry Every Day About Losing Him to the Coronavirus.
description: HOUSTON  Can you hear that? my son, Sam, asked me a month or so ago, interrupting our conversation to hold his phone up to his open car window. Its for essential workers.

title: I Survived Vietnam. Will I Survive This Pandemic?
description: SARNANO, Italy  A very long time ago, I was one of more than two million American men and women who served their country in Vietnam. We fought; too many of us became casualties and died. We were gone from home and half forgotten, living and dying in an alternative reality.

title: Why America Loves U.F.C., the First Sport to Return
description: It comes as no surprise to its ardent followers that the Ultimate Fighting Championship, known as U.F.C., will be the first organization to stage a major professional sports event in the United States since the spread of Covid-19 induced a monthslong live sports hiatus. Its brash president, Dana White, never wanted to cease operations in the first place.

title: 10 Films to Watch With Mom
description: Some of us may be far from family this year, but we can still celebrate Mom, wherever she is. Weve put together a collection of our favorite short documentaries for Mothers Day, by some of the best filmmakers around. Even if youre not watching together, these are films to stream with family and then jump on the phone or Zoom to ask each other: Which one moved you most?

title: Andre Harrell, Executive Who Bridged Hip-Hop and R&B, Dies at 59
description: Andre Harrell, an innovative music executive who in the late 1980s founded Uptown Records, a crucial bridge between the worlds of hip-hop and R&B, and who gave the first career break to Sean Combs, today one of hip-hops signature moguls and global ambassadors, died on Thursday night at his home in West Hollywood, Calif. He was 59.

title: Back to College in the Fall?
description: To the Editor:

title: An Ode to the Humble Balcony
description: My toddler and I have a new favorite activity: craning our necks to catch a glimpse of the neighbors. Since we have been instructed to stay at home in our apartment in a triple-decker in Somerville, Mass., we have gotten quite good at it.

title: Will We Face Depression-Era Job Losses? Lets Not Find Out
description: On Friday, the Labor Department announced that over 20.5 million Americans lost their jobs in April, bringing the unemployment rate to 14.7 percent. This level of devastation has not been reached since the Great Depression. With more than one in four companies shuttered to minimize the pandemics death toll and at least 30 million workers seeking unemployment benefits, we are in the throes of an unprecedented jobs crisis.

title: F.D.A. Approves First Antigen Test for Detecting the Coronavirus
description: The Food and Drug Administration has approved the first antigen test that can rapidly detect whether a person has been infected by the coronavirus, a significant advancement that promises to greatly expand the nations testing capacity.

title: Whistle-Blower Exposes Infighting and Animus in Trumps Coronavirus Response
description: WASHINGTON  The call in early February from the White House Situation Room came as a surprise to Rick Bright: Peter Navarro, President Trumps trade adviser, wanted him to come present his ideas for fighting the coronavirus, alone.

title: Nerve-Racking and Very Unusual: Snow in May Worries Growers
description: Across New York and New England, farmers and growers watched with worry on Saturday morning as a late season blast of Arctic air and even snow descended on fragile fruits and vegetables that had just begun to poke through.

title: As South Korea Eases Limits, Virus Cluster Prompts Seoul to Close Bars
description: Go out, socialize and have fun, South Koreas government told its people, declaring the start of a new daily life with Covid-19  while keeping a vigilant eye out for any sign of backsliding, any need for restrictions to snap back into place.

title: Why Some Women Call This Recession a Shecession
description: C. Nicole Mason, president and chief executive of the Institute for Womens Policy Research

title: Live and Let Die, Trump-Style
description: WASHINGTON  This is not a good time for vampires.

title: William Barrs Perversion of Justice
description: History is written by the winners, William Barr, the attorney general, said Thursday when asked how he thought future generations would assess his decision to drop all criminal charges against Michael Flynn, President Trumps former national security adviser, who had pleaded guilty twice to breaking the law. So it largely depends on whos writing the history.

title: Hillary Never Married Bill
description: Curtis Sittenfeld likes to imagine the sex lives of presidents.

title: Losing My Mom to Alzheimers, Then Finding Her Again
description: I lost my mother at about this time last year, after her 10-year struggle with Alzheimers disease. During this past year, kind friends have checked in at holidays and birthdays, understandably assuming these first landmark occasions without my mom would be difficult. The truth is something that I was at first ashamed to admit, let alone articulate: Grieving her now, when the loss is complete, feels nothing like I had expected. It feels easy.

title: For Flynn, Dropped Charges Are the Latest in a Life Full of Reversals
description: WASHINGTON  There have always been two sides to Michael T. Flynn. There was the rebellious teenager who surfed during hurricanes and spent a night in juvenile reformatory. Then there was the adult who buckled down, joined the Army and rose to become a three-star general.

title: Elon Musk Lashes Out at Officials Keeping Tesla Plant Closed Over Virus
description: Elon Musk and local health officials in California clashed on Saturday over the timing of the reopening of Teslas factory in Fremont, with the companys chief executive pushing for an immediate return and the countys government seeking a delay of about a week.

title: Jimmy Glenn, Ex-Boxer Whose Times Square Bar Endures, Dies at 89
description: This obituary is part of a series about people who have died in the coronavirus pandemic. Read about others here.

title: A First Among Gerber Babies: Shes Adopted
description: After featuring nearly a dozen tiny brand ambassadors as the face of its baby food and other early childhood products, Gerber announced on Friday it had selected the first adopted spokesbaby in its 92-year history.

title: Divorcing Parents Have a Right to Post Their Stories Online, Court Says
description: The acrimonious split of Masha and Ronnie Shak ended up where many divorces do these days  on Facebook.

title: Border Crossings
description: SUNDAY PUZZLE  Everyone here loves to find the theme, and theres something special about a theme that exposes something hidden in plain sight. Today we have an example of this phenomenon that takes I cant believe nobody ever noticed this before! to the nth degree.

title: How Justin Gaethje Won the Interim Lightweight Title at U.F.C. 249
description: Justin Gaethje and Tony Ferguson were matched to provide action.

title: Virus Conspiracists Elevate a New Champion
description: In a video posted to YouTube on Monday, a woman animatedly described an unsubstantiated secret plot by global elites like Bill Gates and Dr. Anthony Fauci to use the coronavirus pandemic to profit and grab political power.

title: Mysterious Coronavirus Illness Claims 3 Children in New York
description: A mysterious syndrome has killed three young children in New York and sickened 73 others, Gov. Andrew M. Cuomo said on Saturday, an alarming rise in a phenomenon that was first publicly identified earlier this week.

title: Angelina Jolie: A Mothers Strength
description: Mothers Day is hard for anyone who has lost their mom, but this year must be particularly so because of coronavirus. So many people have lost a parent suddenly, without being by their side, able to care for them and return their love in the way theyd always imagined.

title: In Chicago and Los Angeles, Virus Spread Is Slower, but Persistent
description: As cases of the coronavirus spiraled upward in New York City, leaders of other big cities watched with worry, searching for ways to avoid an escalation of the magnitude that might overwhelm hospitals. In Chicago, the nations third-largest city, fear of explosive growth  the kind that overtook New York City, Detroit and New Orleans  has faded in recent days, but the Chicago area has faced its own stubbornly high numbers.

title: Teenager, an Aspiring Detective, Returns $135,000 He Found
description: Jose Nuez Romaniz was headed to the bank to deposit money so he could buy socks online for his grandfather when he came upon a large clear plastic bag filled with cash next to an A.T.M. in Albuquerque.

title: Quotation of the Day: Deep Yearning for Hometown Lost to a Virus
description: Just everything. I miss everything.

title: Victoria Hammarskjold, George Lemmon III
description: Victoria Frances Hammarskjold and George Blackmore Lemmon III were married May 9. The couple self-united, as allowed by Pennsylvania law, at their home in Devon, Pa.

title: Corrections: May 10, 2020
description: A capsule summary of an article on Saturday about prosecutors concerns over Attorney General William P. Barrs handling of the criminal case against President Trumps former national security adviser Michael T. Flynn misstated the action taken by Mr. Barr. The attorney general dropped the case; Mr. Flynn was not pardoned.

title: Boris Johnson Announces a Coronavirus Quarantine for Travelers to U.K.: Live Coverage
description: Worldwide, the officially reported number of coronavirus cases has soared above four million people across 177 countries, and more than a quarter million people have died, according to a New York Times database.

title: Whats on TV Sunday: I Know This Much Is True and Call Your Mother
description: I KNOW THIS MUCH IS TRUE 9 p.m. on HBO; stream on HBO platforms. This limited series, based on Wally Lambs 1998 novel, stars Mark Ruffalo as the twins Dominick and Thomas Birdsey. Written and directed by Derek Cianfrance (Blue Valentine, The Place Beyond the Pines), the six-episode series follows Dominick as he tries to care for his brother, who has schizophrenia, and who cuts off his right hand in the opening scene of the book. To embody two distinctly different identical twins, Ruffalo told The New York Times that he gained 30 pounds during a six-week filming break before shooting his scenes as Thomas. As the twins deal with familial trauma and mental illness, they grapple with the messy nature of care and conflict.

title: S.N.L. Salutes Mothers as Baldwins Trump Gives Advice to Graduates
description: A Saturday Night Live season that was more abrupt than intended and still more generous than it had to be came to a bittersweet end this weekend.

title: Bangkok Opens Up as Virus Caseloads Drop, and Pretty Pups Benefit
description: BANGKOK  When the coronavirus lockdown in Bangkok eased a bit after six weeks, the first appointment my family made was not for a medical checkup or a walk in a park.

title: Why the Path to Reopening New York City Will Be So Difficult
description: Nearly 190,000 people were tested for the coronavirus in New York City over the past two weeks, a record number. The increase in testing, crucial for curbing the outbreak, came as Mayor Bill de Blasio announced plans to hire a small army of 1,000 disease detectives to track down the contacts of every infected New Yorker.

title: The Death of James Jordan: What We Know
description: Update Aug. 18: Larry Demery, who pleaded guilty to first-degree murder in the death of James Jordan, has been granted parole and is scheduled to be released on Aug. 6, 2023.

title: Keeping Online Testing Honest? Or an Orwellian Overreach?
description: SACRAMENTO  As Daniel Farzannekou prepared to take an online exam late last month in his naval science elective at the University of California, Los Angeles, the software directed him to pick up his laptop and scan his room, his desk, his ID and his face.

title: Democrats Vote-by-Mail Effort Won in Wisconsin: Will It Work Elsewhere?
description: It was a shocking margin of victory in what was expected to be a close race: an 11-point blowout by a liberal judge over a conservative incumbent for a seat on the Wisconsin Supreme Court.

title: Homes That Sold for Around $1 Million
description: Each week, our survey of recent residential sales in New York City and the surrounding region focuses on homes that sold around a certain price point, allowing you to compare single-family homes, condos and co-ops in different locales.

title: Lost Your Job but Still Have a 401(k)? Heres What to Do With It
description: Tens of millions of Americans have lost their jobs as the coronavirus ravages the economy, bringing the unemployment rate to a Great Depression-level 14.7 percent  and many are looking for emergency lifelines to meet living expenses.

title: Franklin Graham Is Taking Down His N.Y. Hospital, but Not Going Quietly
description: The last patients have been discharged from the Central Park field hospital run by Samaritans Purse, the evangelical organization led by the Rev. Franklin Graham. Its white tents will soon be dismantled and sent to new makeshift coronavirus wards as far away as Ecuador and Alaska.

description: When will the Covid-19 pandemic end? And how?

title: Pork Chops vs. People: Battling Coronavirus in an Iowa Meat Plant
description: On April 10, Tony Thompson, the sheriff for Black Hawk County in Iowa, visited the giant Tyson Foods pork plant in Waterloo. What he saw, he said, shook me to the core.

description: Happy weirdest Mothers Day ever to all the moms out there, especially mine, whom Im not sure when Ill see next (besides on Zoom, of course). To everyone else, hang in there. Heres what you need to know in business and tech for the week ahead.

title: Little Richards Queer Triumph
description: It was during a 1966 concert in Paris when Little Richard, drenched in sweat, told a mostly white audience, Im ready, ready, ready teddy, Im ready, ready, ready teddy! He took off his soaked shirt and the men and women pleaded for it as he swung it over his head like a helicopter, carefully considering who he would bless with his dripping D.N.A.

title: The Sunday Read: The Iceman in Winter
description: Listen and subscribe to our podcast from your mobile device:Via Apple Podcasts | Via Spotify | Via Stitcher

title: Daniel Dae Kim on Asian-Americans: Ugly History, Relevant Again
description: In late March, the actor Daniel Dae Kim posted a video on Instagram revealing that he had tested positive for Covid-19. Back then Kim, best known for memorable roles on Lost and Hawaii Five-0, was one of the early well-known carriers of the coronavirus, having potentially contracted it while filming his NBC medical drama New Amsterdam in New York City. He documented his recovery process online while most Americans were just beginning to comprehend the impact of the pandemic.

title: Pregnant in a Pandemic? These 5 Mothers of Newborns Have Advice
description: Before the coronavirus, expectant mothers relied on support from family and friends to help them recover from painful deliveries and adapt to unpredictable life with a newborn. Now many parents have to go it alone and make gut-wrenching decisions:

title: Europes Battle-Hardened Nations Show Resilience in Virus Fight
description: BRUSSELS  As the coronavirus has hopscotched the world, a paradox has emerged: Rich nations are not necessarily better at fighting the crisis than poorer ones.

title: Thomas Reppetto, Crime Watchdog and Historian, Is Dead at 88
description: Thomas Reppetto, a former Chicago police officer who became a respected historian of policing and the leader of a nonpartisan watchdog group that researches ways to reduce crime in New York City, died on Tuesday at his home in Mount Vernon, N.Y. He was 88.

title: What to Cook This Week
description: Good morning. How are you doing? I know its not easy, not if youre flying solo, not if youre crammed into a too-small apartment with two dogs and a baby, not if youre on a saltwater farm 17 miles from town with grandchildren romping in the soft spring grass. Its not easy if youre not working. Its not easy if youre working or going to school, either. Its not easy for any of us. The futures still out there, mirage-like in the distance. Sometimes it looks promising  as if summer could bring normalcy, a haircut, a trip to the crowded farmers market, a swim at the beach, at the pond, at the rec-center pool in town. But its often the opposite. Fears like that: awful and menacing. Theres so much we dont know, cant know, cant imagine.

title: In U.K., Hard-Hit Minority Communities Struggle to Bury the Dead
description: BIRMINGHAM, England  Normally, the mosque, one of Englands largest, would be filled with thousands of worshipers during the holy month of Ramadan, but now it is mostly empty, except for stacks of coffins.

title: Ahmaud Arbery and the America That Doesnt Exist
description: WHEATON, Ill.  Football does not prepare its athletes for a life of fitness. Its drills and exercises are meant to harden the body for collisions. After our playing days are over, we must find new ways to keep our bodies in shape.

title: The Epidemic Within the Pandemic: Delirium
description: It used to be taken for granted that old people would get confused and disoriented in the hospital. It is not a minor problem. Delirium, as the condition is called, can keep people in the hospital longer, inhibit treatment and even increase the likelihood of death.

title: After 4 Years of Silence, a Call to Mom on Mothers Day
description: Call, I demanded of myself. Call her now.

title: We Treated Older Coronavirus Patients. Heres How to Save More of Them.
description: We are emergency and I.C.U. doctors who have worked in three hothouses of the Covid-19 pandemic: Northern Italy, New York City and Miami. Treating scores of critically ill patients, we all observed similar patterns: Many of the patients we saw in our emergency rooms had advanced cases of Covid-19 pneumonia when they arrived  and many of those critically ill patients came from nursing homes.

title: A Nightmare: Losing a Home to Australias Fires, Then Locked Down by a Virus
description: MELBOURNE, Australia  The scent of burning debris had just begun to fade from Lindy Marshalls memory when disaster struck again.

title: A Fight Over the Future of the Mail Breaks Down Along Familiar Lines
description: Its roots stretch back almost 250 years to the Second Continental Congress. Americans consistently rate it their favorite federal agency, and with a work force of more than half a million scattered across the country, it employs more people than any government entity outside the military.

title: Chatting via Zoom: A Blessing or a Blight?
description: To the Editor:

title: Self-Interest and Profiteering During a Pandemic
description: To the Editor:

title: Concert to Test Whether America Is Ready to Rock Again
description: Being first is often a good thing, but the opening this week of what could be the first major concert in the United States is turning into a fraught affair.

title: Questions of Bias in Covid-19 Treatment Add to the Mourning for Black Families
description: Long dissatisfied with the doctor treating his diabetes, Reginald Relf decided to fight through whatever was causing his nagging cough. But then his temperature spiked and his breathing became so labored that he reluctantly took his sisters advice to visit a doctor.

title: White House Races to Contain Virus in Its Ranks: It Is Scary to Go to Work
description: WASHINGTON  The Trump administration is racing to contain an outbreak of the coronavirus inside the White House, as some senior officials believe that the disease is already spreading rapidly through the warren of cramped offices that make up the three floors of the West Wing.

title: Paramedics, Strained in the Hot Zone, Pull Back From CPR
description: NEWARK  The calls for patients in cardiac arrest came in one after another.

title: Betty Wright, Soul Singer Who Mentored a New Generation, Dies at 66
description: Betty Wright, a powerful singer who had a breakout hit single when she was 17, then went on to be a key player in the Miami funk sound of the 1970s, and worked closely with singers and rappers in the following four decades, died on Sunday at her home in Miami. She was 66.

title: Comfort Viewing: 3 Reasons I Love Little House on the Prairie
description: LOS ANGELES  About 15 years ago, I stopped by the old Tower Records on the Sunset Strip in West Hollywood. I browsed the CD area. Meh. But I did find a DVD that I couldnt live without, and I brought it to the register, where a trendier-than-thou clerk suddenly appeared.

title: Surviving Covid-19 May Not Feel Like Recovery for Some
description: ROME  When Morena Colombi tested negative for the coronavirus on March 16, the official tallies counted her among the Covid-19 recoveries, a success amid the tragedies overwhelming Italy. But she was nowhere near recovered, her cough and crippling fatigue nowhere near gone.

title: Lebanons Economic Crisis Explodes, Threatening Decades of Prosperity
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon  Flawed policies and sudden shocks have thrust Lebanon into its worst economic crisis in decades, with its currency collapsing, businesses shutting, prices for basic goods skyrocketing and the threat of hunger looming for its poorest people.

title: Has Trump Decided We Will Follow Sweden and Just Not Told Us?
description: Having a pandemic is really bad. Having a pandemic and a civil war together is really, really bad. Welcome to Donald Trumps America 2020.

title: Jaquelin Taylor Robertson, Architect and Passionate Urbanist, Dies at 87
description: Jaquelin Taylor Robertson, an architect who grew up on a grand classical estate in Virginia before becoming one of New Yorks most prominent and impassioned advocates of urban design, died on Saturday at his home in East Hampton, N.Y. He was 87.

title: A Lifetime of Running With Ahmaud Arbery Ends With a Text: We Lost Maud
description: ATLANTA  Long after Akeem Baker escaped the orbit of small-town Georgia, he would continue to rely on his best friend, Ahmaud Arbery. He had relied on him almost from the beginning.

title: Little Richard: An Ecstasy You Couldnt Refuse
description: Wild and outrageous dont begin to describe Little Richard. He hit American pop like a fireball in the mid-1950s, a hopped-up emissary from cultures that mainstream America barely knew, drawing on the sacred and the profane, the spiritual and the carnal. He had deep experience in the sanctified church and in the chitlin circuit of African-American clubs and theaters, along with drag shows, strip joints and, even in the 20th century, minstrel shows.

title: Skadden Said to Have Paid $11 Million to Settle Ukraine Dispute
description: WASHINGTON  The New York-based law firm Skadden, Arps, Slate, Meagher & Flom has paid $11 million or more to avoid a lawsuit by a former Ukrainian prime minister, Yulia V. Tymoshenko, who blamed the firm for aiding in her political persecution.

title: Ex-Deputy Charged After Armed White Mob Confronts Black Family
description: A former sheriffs deputy faces charges after terrorizing a black family in North Carolina as part of a large group of white men and women, some of whom were armed, in what appeared to be a case of mistaken identity, officials said.

title: Let the Pandemic Apologies Begin
description: Before we were all nudged, advised and ordered to repeatedly wash our hands, wear face masks, stay home and social distance, some of us did so by choice. You know who we are, the ones you mocked, at whom you rolled your eyes, and for whom you made up nicknames.

title: New York City Cant Afford to Get This Wrong
description: Much is uncertain about New York Citys future amid coronavirus  the timeline for reopening, the timeline for development of treatments and a vaccine. But one thing has remained clear: In order to safely reopen, cities like New York must develop the capacity to regularly test portions of the population, trace the spread of the virus and isolate those who have been exposed. And as the count of those struggling both in health and finances continues to mount, time is of the essence. New York needs contact tracing quickly.

title: As Europe Reopens Schools, Relief Combines With Risk
description: NEUSTRELITZ, Germany  It was Lea Hammermeisters first day back at school after almost two months at home and she was already preparing for a test.

description: (Want to get this briefing by email? Heres the sign-up.)

title: Britain to Impose Quarantine on Air Travelers to Fight Coronavirus
description: LONDON  Prime Minister Boris Johnson announced on Sunday that Britain would soon impose a mandatory quarantine on travelers arriving in the country by air to try to avert a new wave of coronavirus infections, signaling how cautious the country will be in relaxing its seven-week lockdown.

title: Bill Barr Twisted My Words in Dropping the Flynn Case. Heres the Truth.
description: At the direction of Attorney General Bill Barr, the Justice Department last week moved to dismiss a false-statements charge against Michael Flynn, President Trumps former national security adviser. The reason stated was that the continued prosecution would not serve the interests of justice.

title: Not Quite a Car, Not Quite a Motorcycle: A Vehicle Built for One
description: For decades, the best-selling vehicles in the United States have been pickup trucks. Hulking, gas-powered models from Ford, Ram and Chevy have had a grip on the market that seems unbreakable.

title: Whats Going On in This Picture? | May 11, 2020
description: Students

title: Repeat After Me: The Markets Are Not the Economy
description: The stock market looks increasingly divorced from economic reality.

title: From Coffee Filter to Safety Mask, in a Hurry
description: BERLIN  As the wave of coronavirus infections broke over Europe in March, causing reserves of medical supplies to disappear, German authorities made a nationwide appeal: More safety masks were urgently needed.

title: The Whole Place Is Sick Now: 74 Deaths at a Home for U.S. Veterans
description: The coronavirus has preyed on residents of nursing homes in New Jersey with lethal force, claiming 4,953 lives. Deaths at long-term care facilities now account for more than half of the states Covid-19 fatalities, well over the national rate.

title: Group That Meets on the Slopes
description: MONDAY PUZZLE  Looking at the current weather, I feel like half of you will see the photo above and want to storm the snow fort that I almost managed to build, yesterday, in New York. Hopefully the murder hornets all turned stinger and flew south!

title: Ethiopian Troops May Have Shot Down Aid Plane in Somalia, Report Says
description: NAIROBI, Kenya  A plane carrying humanitarian supplies that crashed in Somalia on Monday may have been shot down by Ethiopian troops, according to a new report from the office of the African Union Force Commander in Somalia.

title: The Airline Business Is Terrible. It Will Probably Get Even Worse.
description: Delta Air Lines started 2020 celebrating what it said was the most successful year in company history. Not long after, it shared a record $1.6 billion in profits with its 90,000 employees. But with air travel nearly shut down by the coronavirus, the airline is now bleeding money and will drop 10 more airports from its already skeletal network on Wednesday.

title: Shark Attack Kills Surfer in Northern California
description: A man was killed in a shark attack as he was surfing at a state beach in Northern California on Saturday, the authorities said.

title: Gate Was Zero, but Dana White Says U.F.C. 249 Was a Success
description: At a news conference after a pay-per-view card, Dana White, the Ultimate Fighting Championship president, usually strolls to the dais clutching a sheet of paper and reads out the events attendance and ticket revenue.

title: Does Anyone Actually Work for Trump?
description: This we already know: The president has contempt for expertise. During a national emergency, President Trumps top economic adviser is a former television host; his supply-chain coordinator is his son-in-law, who majored in nepotism and prioritizes the leads and needs of cronies; the chief of staff at his Department of Health and Human Services is a former breeder of Australian labradoodles, an insolently unqualified choice if there ever was one, though at least the man is well versed in the behaviors of lapdogs.

title: Can the Democrats Avoid Trumps China Trap?
description: Before the pandemic, before the Great Recession, before proliferating hurricanes and fires, the United States began a global war on terrorism. Its leaders fixated on a shadowy enemy abroad as life at home crumbled for millions of Americans. The war on terrorism did not end terrorism; the war itself became endless. What it did shatter was the myth that a triumphant United States could bend the world to its will.

title: How to Outflank Trump Online
description: While former Vice President Joe Biden spent nearly a year nailing down the Democratic presidential nomination, the Trump campaign devoted the better part of the past four years vacuuming up as much data as possible to better target and influence American voters.

title: In Ahmaud Arberys Hometown, Pain, Anger and Pride in a Shared Racial History
description: BRUNSWICK, Ga.  A 26-year-old black man stood on the steps of the old brick courthouse on Friday and decried the shooting death of another black man who would have turned 26 that day had he lived to see it. That could have easily been me, he said.

title: U.S. to Accuse China of Trying to Hack Vaccine Data, as Virus Redirects Cyberattacks
description: WASHINGTON  The F.B.I. and the Department of Homeland Security are preparing to issue a warning that Chinas most skilled hackers and spies are working to steal American research in the crash effort to develop vaccines and treatments for the coronavirus. The efforts are part of a surge in cybertheft and attacks by nations seeking advantage in the pandemic.

title: The Hunger Pains of a Pandemic
description: Have you ever been hungry? Truly hungry? Not the hunger one gets in anticipation of a meal, but the kind that pinches the stomach when you know no food is forthcoming. It is the kind of pang you take to bed with you, the kind that greets you when you rise. It is a bitter physical deprivation that gnaws at not only the gut but the spirit. It makes you sad. It makes you angry.

title: Big Tech Has Crushed the News Business. Thats About to Change.
description: It reads like a coroners report on the news business, 623 pages filled with charts and graphs detailing the devastating decline in local news and public policy reporting of the past decade. It landed on the Australian prime ministers desk last summer, unnoticed by most news consumers in America and around the world.

title: How the Outlander Team Managed That Shocking Season Finale
description: This interview includes spoilers for the Season 5 finale of Outlander.

title: Billions Season 5, Episode 2 Recap: Step Up to the Mike
description: Welcome to the Mike Conference, named with characteristic humility by its founder, decabillionaire Mike Prince. Its a place for fireside chats that double as vicious duels, for charitable acts that serve to ameliorate an exponentially larger number of uncharitable ones, and for the occasional late-night excursion to a strip club that doubles as a Wagner family reunion.

title: Iranian Friendly Fire Kills 19 in 2nd Missile Accident of Year
description: For the second time this year, Iran appears to have fired a missile at the wrong target with deadly consequences, raising questions about its ability to control its weapons and increasing tensions in the Persian Gulf.
