description: When, early in the onset of the novel coronavirus pandemic, production shortages of medical grade N95 masks turned obtaining them into a hunt for the grail, D.I.Y. ingenuity kicked into gear.

title: First Virtual New York Art Fair Brings Low Energy but Solid Prices
description: There were no air kisses. No celebrity sightings. No champagne flutes in the V.I.P. lounge  in fact, no V.I.P. lounge at all.

title: Make It Ahead
description: Hello and welcome to Five Weeknight Dishes. My daughter said something kind of funny the other day at lunch: Dinner is coming for us, Mama! She was just narrating the events of the day as she expected them to unfold, using her toddler syntax. But she had divined a feeling I often have these days: Dinner is coming for us! Run!

title: Using Tech to Teach  Smartly
description: This article is part of the On Tech newsletter. You can sign up here to receive it weekdays.

title: Will Working From Home Become the Norm?
description: To the Editor:

title: The Paralympics Got Postponed. A Retired Champion Got an Idea.
description: Along with the rest of the world, athletes have had their careers upended by the coronavirus pandemic. They are giving The New York Times an intimate look at their journeys in periodic installments through the rest of the year.

title: How Do You Feel About Returning to Work?
description: America has started to reopen, just weeks after the coronavirus put most of the country on lockdown.

title: Is the Hand Quicker Than the Zoom Window?
description: Before my scheduled preview performance of The Present, a new show from the Geffen Playhouse (rebranded as Geffen Stayhouse) in Los Angeles, I received  via FedEx, after a failed delivery from the Postal Service and a series of increasingly panicked emails  a letter with strict instructions. I was to download Zoom and join a meeting 15 minutes before showtime. There would be, bold type informed me, no late seating.

title: When Sheltering in Place Puts Your Tax Strategy at Risk
description: Lockdowns have disrupted the lives of millions of Americans since March, when states began issuing shelter-in-place orders. For some people, a key part of their residency for tax purposes  their domicile status  may have shifted in that time for a number of reasons: They are now working from home, theyve fled a hot spot or they thought they could ride out the pandemic in a vacation house.

title: Why Are Women-Led Nations Doing Better With Covid-19?
description: Monday was a day of triumph for Prime Minister Jacinda Ardern. Thanks to the efforts of the entire nation, she said, New Zealand had been largely successful in meeting its ambitious goal of eradicating, rather than just controlling, outbreaks of Covid-19. The lockdown she had put in place on March 25 could now end.

title: To Build Resilience in Isolation, Master the Art of Time Travel
description: As isolation day approached, Scott Kelly knew he had to prepare himself mentally. He wouldnt be able to hug his family and friends. He wouldnt be able to go outside without protective gear. Hed have a hard time sleeping, because hed be going to bed in his office and waking up in that same office  on the International Space Station.

title: Whos Enforcing Mask Rules? Often Retail Workers, and Theyre Getting Hurt
description: The exchange was tense between the customer and Jesse, a Trader Joes employee sporting a white face mask and a flowery Hawaiian shirt.

title: Hightown Review: Crime on Cape Cod, With a Hint of Elmore Leonard
description: Jackie Quiones, the heroine of the new Starz policier Hightown, is an off-brand variety of cop, a fisheries agent who boards boats looking for contraband or lobsters that are too young. Shes feisty and contrarian and lives and works in a scenic area with a distinctive local culture, Cape Cod.

title: Tanglewood, Musical Haven in the Berkshires, Cancels Summer Season
description: Summer after summer, the Boston Symphony Orchestra retreats to its seasonal home: Tanglewood, a bucolic and beloved outdoor destination for music, tucked away in the Berkshires. New Englands vacationers and classical buffs follow by the hundreds of thousands.

title: One Young Mother and the Homelessness Crisis
description: Subscribe: iTunes | Google Play Music | How to Listen

title: S. Roger Horchow, Retailer Turned Broadway Producer, Dies at 91
description: A boy in Cincinnati wakes up in the night to hear striking piano music  alive, exciting, he would describe it decades later  emanating from a gathering his parents are having downstairs. He goes to investigate and sees George Gershwin himself at the piano.

title: Wuhan Diary Offers an Angry and Eerie View From Inside Quarantine
description: The next Chinese New Year will begin on Feb. 12, 2021. It will be the year of the Ox. The first real publishing season since the pandemic started will begin at about the same time. In America and elsewhere, I suspect, it will be the year of the Diary.

title: U.K. Coronavirus Testers Pay Price for a Day of Triumph
description: LONDON  On May 1, a visibly relieved Matt Hancock announced that the British government had exceeded its target of 100,000 coronavirus tests a day. As health secretary, Mr. Hancock had set the goal after enduring intense criticism for the countrys lagging coronavirus testing program.

title: Let Vegetables Be the Star of Your Memorial Day
description: The sad truth about summer 2020 is that you may not be ushering it in by grilling giant trays of food for a horde of your family and friends.

title: Dealing With the Dark Side of Low Interest Rates
description: The extraordinarily low interest rates in place today are a boon when youre buying a house, refinancing a mortgage, leasing a car or paying off student debt. If you qualify for a loan, low rates can help you spend less and get more.

title: Is It Safe to Go Out to Eat?
description: Restaurants are slowly returning in many states. Just because you can eat out again, though, does not mean that you should. And if you decide to go back before the virus is under control, it will not necessarily be clear which dining rooms are safest.

title: Californias Warning Signs for Democrats
description: Before the pandemic, visitors to the Ronald Reagan Library were greeted by a hologram of the 40th president, speaking one day from his ranch and the next from the Oval Office.

title: What Parents Should Know as States Reopen
description: After a month or two in virtual confinement, most of us are going downright stir crazy. Theres only so much Puffin Rock and Masha the Bear we can take. Meanwhile, our kids are crawling up the walls. As most states have begun reopening amid the coronavirus pandemic, people are anxious to know what activities their kids can safely do. Can children have play dates or go to the playground? Can parents hire babysitters?

title: How the Biden Campaign Aims to Win Battleground States
description: Joseph R. Biden Jr.s presidential campaign, which has faced criticism from some Democrats worried about his teams general election readiness, is planning a substantial expansion of its operation and eyeing an ambitious battleground map even as the question of when Mr. Biden will resume in-person campaigning remains unclear.

title: As His Pay Shrinks in the Absence of Tennis, His Heart Grows Fonder
description: People throughout the sports world, from athletes to arena staff members, tell The New York Times how their lives have changed during the coronavirus pandemic.

title: Love Letter: Living Alone in a Pandemic
description: [Sign up here to receive Love Letter, a weekly newsletter about relationship highs, lows and woes, in your inbox every Friday.]

title: Shes 108, Lived Through the Spanish Flu and Just Beat Covid-19
description: Last month, relatives of Sylvia Goldsholl received troubling news from her New Jersey nursing home: She had contracted the coronavirus and was in isolation.

title: Gil Loescher, 75, Refugees Expert Who Survived Iraq Bombing, Dies
description: The Iraq war had gone on for six months when Gil Loescher, a scholar and champion of refugees rights, arrived in Baghdad in August 2003 as a member of openDemocracy, a London-based human rights organization. On Aug. 19, he and others went to the United Nations headquarters there to discuss the humanitarian costs of the war with Srgio Vieira de Mello, the U.N. special representative in Iraq.

title: Looking at Albert Camuss The Plague
description: In 1948, Stephen Spender wrote for the Book Review about Albert Camuss The Plague, a novel about an epidemic spreading across the French Algerian city of Oran.

title: Christies Gets Creative for 20th-Century Art Auction in July
description: Christies has a new auction format for a July 10 event that it hopes will revive at least some of the drama  and the prices  of the live evening sales that were held pre-pandemic.

title: These No-Bake Bars Are the Next Best Thing to a Peanut Butter Cup
description: Despite the fact that Ive been keeping my family knee-deep in snickerdoodle cake and shortbread, everyones been craving peanut butter cups.

title: An Ex-Steelers Recount of a Hard Hit Triggers Bountygate Comparisons
description: The steepest of the four fines the former Steelers linebacker James Harrison incurred in 2010 stemmed from a vicious helmet-to-helmet hit he delivered on Cleveland Browns receiver Mohamed Massaquoi, knocking him out with a concussion. The hit went without penalty on the field, but the N.F.L., intent on meting out stiffer discipline for violations of player safety, docked Harrison $75,000  at least some of which, Harrison claimed on a podcast Thursday, was offset by his coach, Mike Tomlin.

title: With Move to Remote Voting, House Alters What It Means for Congress to Meet
description: When the House of Representatives acted on Friday to allow remote voting and virtual hearings, the coronavirus pandemic officially succeeded in doing what Philadelphias yellow fever outbreak of 1793, the Spanish influenza of 1918, the Sept. 11, 2001, attacks and generations of agitators for institutional change never could: untethering Congress from its mandate to come together physically.

title: What We Know About Your Chances of Catching the Virus Outdoors
description: The warmer weather across the country calls to mind carefree summers  picnics in the park, swimming at the beach, fireworks on the Fourth. But nothing feels carefree now.

title: Geriatric, Chinas Puppet: Trump Campaign Unleashes Ads Attacking Biden
description: The negative ads attacking Joseph R. Biden Jr. on Facebook pages and television screens are as relentless as they are varied, as if plucked from a vintage Trump rally rant: Some make unfounded inferences about his mental state, saying geriatric health is no laughing matter. Others paint the presumptive Democratic nominee as Chinas puppet.

title: From Nearly Free to Out-of-Reach: Gasolines Crazy Price Swing in Venezuela
description: CARACAS, Venezuela  A dollar could once theoretically buy about 5 billion gallons of gasoline in Venezuela  more than enough to supply the state of Michigan for a year. Now, a dollar gets you half a pint, if youre lucky.

title: How to Give Skin a Summer Glow
description: The widespread closure of nonessential businesses has resulted in a variety of unforeseen beauty challenges  not least among them the need for D.I.Y. hair care  and skin is doubly affected: Not only is professional help off the table but spending less time outside can take a noticeable toll on its vibrancy. Everyone wants to look like they just had a facial, even in normal circumstances, says the New York-based makeup artist Gucci Westman. But particularly during these weeks and weeks of quarantine, when we could all use a confidence boost, I want my skin to be glowing and radiant and exude well-being. With stay-at-home orders still in effect in many places, a healthy glow may simply seem unattainable, even as summer approaches  but with a little know-how, bronzers, highlighters and blushes can lend a hand. Here, a guide to achieving a subtle sun-kissed look.

title: Why Ive Stopped Telling People Im Not Chinese
description: Mid-February, when the world was starting to go pear-shaped, I had to travel to an area where Id previously experienced anti-Asian sentiment. So a few days before the trip, I emailed my (white) hairdresser frantically: I know this sounds crazy but can you can make me blonde? Im traveling next week and Im worried about being mistaken for Chinese and blamed for the coronavirus.

title: F.D.A. Halts Coronavirus Testing Program Backed by Bill Gates
description: SEATTLE  An innovative coronavirus testing program in the Seattle area  promoted by the billionaire Bill Gates and local public health officials as a way of conducting wider surveillance on the invisible spread of the virus  has been ordered by the federal government to stop its work pending additional reviews.

title: What Coronavirus Means for Going to the Lake
description: Like many Canadians in areas where this is a holiday weekend, my wife and I would normally be at our cottage, dragging outdoor furniture and small boats out of their winter dens, assessing the handiwork of mice and squirrels and generally getting set up for a summer of fun.

title: With Movie Theaters Closed, Marquees Go Viral
description: Youre still here? Its over. Go home. Go.

title: Ty, British Rapper Who Bridged Generations and Genres, Dies at 47
description: This obituary is part of a series about people who have died in the coronavirus pandemic. Read about others here.

title: Fed Warns of Financial Risks as Coronavirus Downturn Persists
description: The coronavirus outbreak upended markets in March, and the Federal Reserve said on Friday that the financial system had exacerbated that turmoil and warned that highly indebted businesses remained a vulnerability that could hurt the broader economy.

title: A Short Story Collection Based on Our News-Heavy Times
description: If youve tried to read a book  or anything longer than 280 characters  lately, youve likely pondered the role of, and appetite for, fiction in our attention-fractured times. So, too, has Tyler Cabot, since long before the coronavirus swept in.

title: Mortgage Relief That Comes With a $4,000 Bill
description: As the owner of a small marketing agency in central Florida, Edith Duran quickly found herself in a difficult spot as the coronavirus pandemic crippled the local businesses she counts as clients. She couldnt draw her full salary in February, and by March, she was seeking relief on her mortgage.

title: Getting Help With Your Mortgage
description: If you are having trouble paying your mortgage or have already paused your monthly payments through a forbearance, here are some resources that may help:

title: U.S. Urges Afghanistan to Stay the Course With Peace Deal as Violence Resurges
description: WASHINGTON  American officials scrambled on Friday to keep Afghanistans tenuous peace process from falling apart, blaming the Islamic State for horrific attacks that have recently killed dozens of people and further inflamed tensions between the Taliban and the government in Kabul.

title: Two Projects Are Filming Again. Heres How Theyre Doing It.
description: Baltasar Kormakur, the Icelandic director best known in the United States for Everest and Contraband, turned to a color-coded armband system to get his Netflix sci-fi series Katla back into production in Reykjavik after the coronavirus shut it down in mid-March.

title: Trump Blames Tests and Obama
description: To the Editor:

title: The Justice Dept.s Attempt to Drop the Michael Flynn Case, Explained
description: WASHINGTON  Judge Emmet G. Sullivan, who is presiding over the case against President Trumps former national security adviser Michael T. Flynn, has appointed a former mafia prosecutor and retired federal judge, John Gleeson, to argue against Attorney General William P. Barrs attempt to drop the case.

title: Savoring Tea and Toast Through Crisis
description: When we shared our ode to a buttery, sweet piece of toast, paired with a steaming mug of tea on a recent Friday afternoon, listener responses poured in. Wendy Dorr, who edited the story, on how The Daily team picked this comforting combination, and how to make toast and tea like the experts (though how youre doing it now is absolutely correct, too):

title: Learn Guitar with Laura Marling
description: Despite performing for more than a decade, and having seven solo albums to her name, the British folk singer-songwriter Laura Marling insists shes not a natural entertainer. She calls herself the subtle event rather than the life of the party.Accordingly, instead of serenading her fans with concerts from her home in London, she has made the most of her lockdown by livestreaming weekly guitar tutorials on Instagram, @lauramarling. Since late March, Ms. Marling has posted more than a dozen 10-to-15-minute videos breaking down some of her most famous songs, garnering tens of thousands of views.

title: Louis Delsarte, a Muralist of the Black Experience, Dies at 75
description: Louis Delsarte, a noted artist who celebrated African-American history and culture through dreamlike paintings, drawings, prints and, above all, large-scale public murals, died on May 2 in Atlanta. He was 75.

title: When Did the Coronavirus Arrive in the U.S.? Heres a Review of the Evidence.
description: SEATTLE  In a county north of Seattle, two people who came down with respiratory illnesses in December now have antibodies for the coronavirus. In Florida, a public health official who got sick in January believes he had Covid-19.

title: The Trains Stopped Running. Our Night Was Only Beginning.
description: Times Insider explains who we are and what we do, and delivers behind-the-scenes insights into how our journalism comes together.

title: Another Health Minister in Brazil Exits Amid Chaotic Coronavirus Response
description: RIO DE JANEIRO  The Brazilian governments chaotic response to the coronavirus pandemic worsened Friday as its latest health minister quit barely a month into the job, with daily deaths from infection climbing and a defiant president exhorting people to get back to work.

title: There May Not Be Pomp Because of Our Circumstances, Oprah Tells Students
description: Oprah Winfrey addressed graduates in the Class of 2020. More than 75 other celebrities joined her.

title: The Bundesliga Is Back. So Why Isnt Your League?
description: Enjoying this newsletter? Tell a friend to sign up at nytimes.com/rory and then youll have at least one thing to talk about every Friday.

title: Tendol Gyalzur, Refugee Who Founded Orphanages in Tibet, Dies
description: This obituary is part of a series about people who have died in the coronavirus pandemic. Read about others here.

title: Vaccine, Retail Sales, Commencement: Your Friday Evening Briefing
description: (Want to get this briefing by email? Heres the sign-up.)

title: Judge Reinstates Charges Against Engineer in Philadelphia Train Wreck That Killed 8
description: A judge on Thursday reinstated charges against a former Amtrak engineer who was driving a speeding train that derailed in Philadelphia in 2015, killing eight people.

title: Coronavirus Briefing: What Happened Today
description: Sweden is an outlier with its coronavirus response, forgoing the strict lockdowns of its European neighbors. A new Times analysis looked at how that strategy is playing out.

title: N.F.L. Owners Will Review Incentives to Boost Racial Diversity
description: When the N.F.L. owners meet via video conference on Tuesday, they will consider proposals that would give competitive advantages to teams that hire nonwhite candidates for their general manager and top coaching positions, according to several people familiar with the measures who were not authorized to speak publicly about them.

title: J.C. Penney, 118-Year-Old Department Store, Files for Bankruptcy
description: J.C. Penney, with its budget-friendly clothing for families and reliable home furnishings, was for years a cornerstone of American malls and an undeniable success story. What started as a humble dry goods store in Wyoming in 1902 was a century later a national chain with a household name and more than 1,000 locations.

title: Amazon Makes No Promises on Bezos Testimony
description: Amazon responded to lawmakers on Friday who demanded that its chief executive, Jeff Bezos, testify as part of a congressional antitrust investigation.

title: Intelligence Chief Reduces Size of Counterterrorism Office
description: WASHINGTON  The acting intelligence chief announced a reorganization of the National Counterterrorism Center on Friday, part of an effort to reduce the size of the office overseeing the nations spy agencies.

title: Will Britains Pubs Survive the Coronavirus?
description: STROUD, England  A good pub feels a bit like a living room: a familiar, informal space where you can have a pint with friends and strangers. Sometimes there are games, food and a fire, occasionally a dog or cat. There are often pictures of old people on the walls and sports on the television.

title: Kobe Bryant Helicopter Crash Autopsies Say Pilot Tested Negative for Drugs
description: The Los Angeles County coroners office on Friday released autopsies for the victims of the helicopter crash in California that killed the basketball star Kobe Bryant, his 13-year-old daughter, Gianna, and all seven other people on board.

title: A Bit of Relief: Reruns, Rituals and Restaurants
description: Listen and subscribe to our podcast from your mobile device:Via Apple Podcasts | Via Spotify | Via Stitcher

title: Man Faces Terrorism Charge After Threatening to Kill Michigans Governor, Officials Say
description: A Detroit man has been charged with threatening to kill Gov. Gretchen Whitmer of Michigan and the state attorney general, Dana Nessel, prosecutors said on Friday.

title: House Passes $3 Trillion Aid Bill Over Republican Opposition
description: WASHINGTON  A divided House narrowly passed a $3 trillion pandemic relief package on Friday to send aid to struggling state and local governments and another round of direct $1,200 payments to taxpayers, advancing a proposal with no chance of becoming law over near-unanimous Republican opposition.

title: M.L.B.s Efforts to Return to the Field Could Take the Game Back to 1994
description: The best way to sell a product is to convince people that they need it. This concept fuels the overriding fear within Major League Baseball these days. The coronavirus pandemic shut down the league just before the regular season would have started. If baseball remains on hold until 2021, many people will learn to live without it. They will not need the product.

title: The Masked Versus the Unmasked
description: Back in the other world, before all was stilled, a neighbor in Colorado would tell me it was time for liberals to gun up. The other side was armed, he argued, and would stop at nothing. What would we tell our grandchildren when Ivanka Trump took office as the 46th president of the United States in 2025 and term limits were abolished? That we tried words, all manner of them, he scoffed, but they had the rifles.

title: A Sitting President, Riling the Nation During a Crisis
description: Even by President Trumps standards, it was a rampage: He attacked a government whistle-blower who was telling Congress that the coronavirus pandemic had been mismanaged. He criticized the governor of Pennsylvania, who has resisted reopening businesses. He railed against former President Barack Obama, linking him to a conspiracy theory and demanding he answer questions before the Senate about the federal investigation of Michael T. Flynn.

title: U.S. Is Said to Plan to File Antitrust Charges Against Google
description: WASHINGTON  The Justice Department is planning to file antitrust charges against Google as early as this summer, said two people with knowledge of the situation, in what would be one of the biggest antitrust actions by the United States since the late 1990s.

title: Americas Obsession With Cheap Meat
description: In the hierarchy of essential things in America, it appears, cheeseburgers rank near the top. The presidents recent declaration that meatpacking plants are critical infrastructure and meat is essential under the Defense Production Act speaks volumes about this countrys attachment to an abundant supply of beef and pork even amid a pandemic.

title: In This Election, Its the Remote Against the Exposed
description: In February 2016 Peggy Noonan wrote a prescient column in The Wall Street Journal, in which she made the distinction between two classes of people: the protected  that is, the well-off, the connected, the comfortably insulated  and the unprotected  everyone else.

title: Treasury Eases Terms for Small Businesses to Convert Loans to Grants
description: The Treasury Department on Friday made it slightly easier for small-business owners to avoid having to repay government-backed loans they took out under a program designed to keep them from laying off employees and permanently closing.

title: McConnells Rush to Protect Businesses Endangers Everyone Else
description: Theres a tension at the heart of all of the plans to reopen the country in the midst of the coronavirus pandemic: The economy needs Americans to get back to work, but workplaces need employees and customers to feel that coming back wont endanger their health or their lives.

title: Barber Defied Rules and Cut Hair From Home. Now He Has the Virus.
description: The complaint came in last month from a resident of Kingston, a city in New Yorks Hudson Valley: A local barbershop was still performing haircuts, in violation of New Yorks emergency shutdown orders to thwart the coronavirus.

title: Hefty Barriers to Entry
description: SATURDAY PUZZLE  We have a really fun, skillful construction today, by Tracy Gray and Jeff Chen, a couple of veteran puzzlemakers who have worked together before, one of whom has his hands on buckets of data and presumably compiles interesting words the way Dr. Frankenstein hoarded body parts. Its seven debuts are mainly on the edges but there are loads of clever bits and pieces everywhere, a few congenial misdirects, and maybe a sticking point or two for the casual Saturday solver. Mainly, I was pleasantly diverted by various cultural references and nostalgia, like this bunch, a very early version of the entertaining from quarantine family.

title: How the Pandemic Hit Bollywood
description: MUMBAI, India  Bollywood conjures images of ubiquitous stars, but every movie produced in Mumbai is made possible by an army of men and women toiling in the shadows: the extras, the carpenters and caterers, the tailors bent over sewing machines creating glittering costumes, the men putting up movie billboards, the men sitting in the ticket window at the local theater.

title: Corrections: May 16, 2020
description: An article on Friday about threats to the movie theater industry and innovations that might  revive it misstated the expected release date of the film Jurassic World: Dominion. It is the summer of 2021, not this summer.

title: Quotation of the Day: Brazils Health Minister Exits Amid Governments Chaotic Response to Pandemic
description: My investment advice would be not to run into a burning building.

title: Modis Popularity Soars as India Weathers the Pandemic
description: NEW DELHI  Just before the coronavirus arrived in India, Prime Minister Narendra Modi faced serious challenges, perhaps the biggest of his tenure.

title: Brazils Halting Coronavirus Response Has Made It a Hotspot
description: This briefing has ended.

title: Trump Removes State Dept. Inspector General
description: WASHINGTON  President Trump continued his purge of inspectors general late Friday, moving to oust Steve A. Linick, who had served in that post at the State Department since 2013, and replacing him with an ambassador with close ties to Vice President Mike Pence.

title: Judge Orders Los Angeles to Move Homeless People Away From Freeways
description: A federal judge on Friday ordered the Los Angeles authorities to move thousands of homeless people away from freeways and their ramps because of the particularly deadly hazards in those areas, including pollutants, passing cars and potential earthquakes.

title: Suspect in Arbery Shooting Offered to Help Deal With Potential Trespasser
description: BRUNSWICK, Ga.  Two months before Ahmaud Arbery was fatally shot in Glynn County, Ga., a police officer there sent a text to a property owner who was worried about recurring trespassing incidents, a lawyer for the homeowner said on Friday.

title: Whats on TV Saturday: The Great and Graduate Together
description: THE GREAT Stream on Hulu. Before starting this new dramedy, its best to leave your historical knowledge at the door. The Great refers to Catherine the Great (Elle Fanning), the 18th-century empress who became one of Russias most notable leaders after overthrowing her husband, Emperor Peter III (Nicholas Hoult). Created by Tony McNamara, who co-wrote the equally irreverent historical film The Favourite, the show favors the comical and absurd over the factual. Writing in The New York Times, Eleanor Stanford said its witty and self-aware, using a charismatic woman from the past as a conduit through which to explore more modern preoccupations.

title: A Moguls Wife Vanishes. Now Norway Has a National Obsession.
description: FJELLHAMAR, Norway  Her last phone call was at 9:14 a.m., around the time that her husband, one of the richest men in Norway, passed under the security cameras at the gates of his energy and property investment company. Not much later that morning more than 18 months ago, Anne-Elisabeth Falkevik Hagen, 68, vanished from her house in suburban Oslo.

title: The Trout Were Socially Distant, but Not the Family Memories
description: ATTLEBORO, Mass.  I distanced myself from my son Patrick, not as a precaution against the virus  though he is an emergency room nurse and in the thick of things  but because a novice fly fisherman poses enough danger.

title: In Financial Trouble? Track Everything Companies Tell You
description: Every financial services company has a coronavirus relief page on its website right now, filled with reassuring language about the assistance on offer. Federal laws and regulations are supposed to make it easier to get help.

title: When the World Unravels, Braid Your Own Hair
description: Ive worn my hair in the same exact style for six years. Learning to style it myself has brought some comfort of normalcy.

title: How to Let Your Children Be Upset
description: Anastasia Higginbothams first book opens with an image of a child holding a glass of milk. The sky outside is partly cloudy, but still blue. A speech bubble floats in from off the page with a parents words: We have something to tell you.

title: I'm Usually a Conflict Photographer. Now, I'm Documenting My Family.
description: For the first time in my career I decided not to cover a major event. I'm seeing something more timeless and universal.

title: A Springtime of Death in New Orleans
description: The toll of the virus has been grim in New Orleans, taking away lives while also cruelly taking away rituals of loss and mourning.

title: I Left My Troubled City Behind. Now I Feel Guilty.
description: I didnt want to leave the city.

title: Give a Different Kind of Graduation Gift
description: The class of 2020 is graduating into an off-kilter world. Ceremonies are canceled and its not safe to throw an in-person party. But graduates are still celebrating. And gifts are still in order, though in interviews many graduates acknowledged the countrys economic problems, and did not want to create a stress or burden on their families. For many joy and pride are enough.

title: Summer Is Coming. Dont Count on N.Y.C.s Beaches for Relief.
description: For New Yorkers, a refreshing dip in the ocean at Coney Island has long been a staple of summer and a vital source of relief from the heat.

title: Michael Jordan: N.B.A. Champ, Marketing Legend and  Toxic Worker?
description: He showed little mercy when berating co-workers. He seized on their setbacks and scoffed at their maladies. He punched at least two in the head.

title: Can Sports Help Heal a Country? Some Fans Dont Buy the Emotional Pleas
description: Few things would make Pedro Urbaez happier than seeing the Mets play again.

title: Now More Than Ever, Facebook Is a Mark Zuckerberg Production
description: SAN FRANCISCO  On Jan. 27, at a regularly scheduled Monday morning meeting with top executives at Facebook, Mark Zuckerberg turned the agenda to the coronavirus. For weeks, he told his staff, he had been hearing from global health care experts that the virus had the makings of a pandemic, and now Facebook needed to prepare for a worst-case scenario  one in which the companys ability to combat misinformation, scammers and conspiracy theorists would be tested as never before.

title: Stacey Abrams Wants More Than the Vice Presidency
description: The clapping hands appeared on the screen  one, two, a flurry of emojis  flashing under the Facebook Live feed of the former minority leader of the Georgia House of Representatives, Stacey Abrams. It was the socially distanced derivative of the applause she has often encountered in the past year or so, since her narrow loss in the race for governor of Georgia in 2018.

title: Stuck at Home, Men in Japan Learn to Help. Will It Last?
description: TOKYO  Susumu Kataoka was just looking for a diversion from long days sheltering at home with his family during the coronavirus outbreak. He grabbed his drone and took it for a spin around their Tokyo house, snapping some pictures and posting them on Facebook.

title: Remote and Ready to Fight Coronaviruss Next Wave
description: In mid-March, Dr. Jim Bristows wife came down with gastrointestinal issues. Then, she couldnt stop coughing.

title: Travels With John Conway, in 258 Septillion Dimensions
description: When John Horton Conway, the Princeton mathemagician who died in April at age 82, first found fame in the late 1960s and early 70s, he joined the academic equivalent of the jet set. Then at the University of Cambridge, he would fly to Montreal or New York, deliver a lecture on his Conway group  an entity in the realm of mathematical symmetry that inhabits 24 dimensions  and return home all within the space of a day.

title: Why Bombs Made in America Have Been Killing Civilians in Yemen
description: Year after year, the bombs fell  on wedding tents, funeral halls, fishing boats and a school bus, killing thousands of civilians and helping turn Yemen into the worlds worst humanitarian crisis.

title: 5 Takeaways on U.S. Involvement in the Worlds Worst Humanitarian Crisis
description: Long before the coronavirus caused human suffering and economic chaos on a global scale, the worlds worst humanitarian crisis was unfolding in Yemen, the Arab worlds poorest country and one that has been mired in civil war.

title: Married but Living Far Apart
description: Ian Derrer and Daniel James were married in August 2019 in the garden room of a restaurant in Santa Fe, N.M., with each of their 19 guests reading aloud lyrics to the couples favorite Stephen Sondheim love songs. After staying in Santa Fe for a weeklong honeymoon, during which they hiked at Bandelier National Monument and enjoyed the opera La Bohme, the couple drove to Dallas, where Mr. Derrer, 45, lives. The next day, Mr. James, 33, left for Houston, where he lives.

title: Germany Criminalizes Burning of E.U. and Other Foreign Flags
description: BERLIN  German lawmakers have voted to make the destruction of foreign state flags, including that of the European Union, and the denigration of national anthems punishable by a fine and up to three years in prison, in a relatively rare move by a government to protect the symbols of other nations.

title: Iran Sentences French-Iranian Academic to 6 Years in Prison
description: PARIS  A French-Iranian academic who has been detained in Iran for almost a year was sentenced on Saturday to six years in prison on national security charges, according to her lawyer.

title: Afghan Power-Sharing Deal Would Promote General Accused of Rape
description: KABUL, Afghanistan  The two sides in the monthslong dispute over Afghanistans presidential election are close to signing a power-sharing deal, the terms of which include giving top military honors to a former vice president who is accused of torturing and ordering the rape of a political rival while in office.

title: Running Down a Dream
description: Welcome to the Running newsletter! Every Saturday morning, we email runners with news, advice and some motivation to help you get up and running. Sign up here to get it in your inbox.

title: U.S. Lacks Leadership on Virus, Obama Tells Graduates
description: [Follow our live coronavirus pandemic updates.]

title: Rwandan Genocide Suspect Arrested After 23 Years on the Run
description: PARIS  He was behind the radio station whose hate-filled invectives turned Rwandan against Rwandan, neighbor against neighbor, even spouse against spouse. He was the man, it was said, who imported the hundreds of thousands of machetes that allowed countless ordinary people to act upon that hatred in one of the last genocides of the past century.

title: Amazon Reaches Deal With French Unions in Coronavirus Safety Dispute
description: PARIS  Amazon has reached an agreement with French unions to reopen its warehouses in France after a lengthy battle over safety measures to protect workers against the coronavirus, capping the most prominent labor showdown the retailer has faced during the pandemic.

title: Horse Racing Tracks Can Open in New York in June, Cuomo Says
description: [This briefing has ended. For the latest updates on the coronavirus outbreak in the New York area, read Sundays live coverage.]

title: Grandparents to the Rescue
description: After nearly two months of attempting to do our jobs and also educate and care for our 7- and 3-year-olds full time, the cavalry arrived last week in the form of my parents. They are helping my husband and me with kid care, and when I saw them for the first time after our respective quarantines, I cried from joy and relief. They asked my 7-year-old how distance learning was going, and she said, It was a mess before you got here.

title: Coronavirus Cases Slow in U.S., but the Big Picture Remains Tenuous
description: CHICAGO  The number of new coronavirus cases confirmed in the United States has steadily declined in recent days. In New York, the figure has dropped over the past month. The numbers have also plunged in hard-hit Massachusetts and Rhode Island, and some states, including Vermont, Hawaii and Alaska, are reporting few new cases at all.

title: Play-Date Arrangements: Are They Safe or Irresponsible?
description: Q: My 3-year-old daughter has been home with us since March, with virtually no social contact beyond her parents. Im worried about how an extended isolation will affect her development. Another family in our Brooklyn apartment building asked if we would be open to an exclusive play-date arrangement with their child  no other families would be involved outside of ours. What measures could we take to make sure its safe? Is that even possible?

title: A Few Brave Kids Battle a Toxic World
description: If flu-pandemic books make cold sufferers anxious and zombie books make agoraphobics jittery, heres something to rattle the Zyrtec set.

title: Jim Obergefell: L.G.B.T.Q. Discrimination Is a Disgrace
description: To the Editor:

title: Carnival Performer, Newly Separated; Attachment Issues
description: In the tradition of Ransom Riggss Miss Peregrines Home for Peculiar Children and Katherine Dunns Geek Love, Lisa Browns THE PHANTOM TWIN (First Second, 208 pp., $17.99; ages 12 to 16) explores the behind-the-scenes lives of performers in an old-timey circus sideshow, tapping into our fascination  and on some level identification  with these obvious outsiders.

title: Brazil, Once a Leader, Struggles to Contain Virus Amid Political Turmoil
description: [Read more on Brazils Coronavirus cases and deaths.]

title: The Crispiest Oven-Fried Potatoes
description: The weeks most popular dishes include oven-fried patatas bravas with two sauces (above); chicken yassa; and leek risotto with sugar snap peas and pancetta. Find more recipes in the collection below.

title: I Cant Turn My Brain Off: PTSD and Burnout Threaten Medical Workers
description: The coronavirus patient, a 75-year-old man, was dying. No family member was allowed in the room with him, only a young nurse.

title: Saudi Arabias Big Dreams and Easy Living Hit a Wall
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon  Saudi Arabia knows about head-spinning change.

title: Variety: Cascades
description: CASCADES  Who says theres nothing new under the sun? I looked high and low for a precursor to this interesting grid and came up with nothing (and then I asked the constructor, Eric Berlin, who helpfully provided some notes). On first sight, I considered it a variation on Marching Bands, since were working with two sets of clues, and every letter in the grid appears in two entries. It was a very different solving experience, for me at least; more intuitive and relaxing than Marching Bands.

title: Obama Says U.S. Lacks Leadership on Virus in Commencement Speeches
description: Without the springtime rituals of traditional graduation ceremonies, former President Barack Obama delivered two virtual commencement addresses on Saturday, urging millions of high school and college graduates to fearlessly carve a path and to seize the initiative at a time when he says the nations leaders have fumbled the response to the coronavirus pandemic.

title: Grieving Shouldnt Be a Privilege
description: MINNEAPOLIS  My friend Moe was back at work a week after her husband, Andrew, hanged himself by the Mississippi River, just a few miles from their home in northeast Minneapolis.

title: Feds Suspect Vast Fraud Network Is Targeting U.S. Unemployment Systems
description: SEATTLE  A group of international fraudsters appears to have mounted an immense, sophisticated attack on U.S. unemployment systems, creating a network that has already siphoned millions of dollars in payments that were intended to avert an economic collapse, according to federal authorities.

title: Sorry, Abe Lincoln Is Not on the Ballot
description: Abraham Lincoln may have died 155 years ago, but everyone still wants his endorsement.

title: At the Drive-In: Thrills, Chills, Popcorn and Hand Sanitizer
description: WARWICK, N.Y.  In the end, it was the rain, not the virus, that drove some moviegoers to leave the drive-in theater here Friday as a storm interrupted the seasons first shows.

title: How Washington Learned to Embrace the Budget Deficit
description: WASHINGTON  This month, the federal government said it would borrow a record-breaking $3 trillion from April to June to help businesses and workers get through the coronavirus-induced recession. In April alone, the United States recorded a larger budget deficit in a single month than it did for all of the 2017 fiscal year, a total of $738 billion.

title: Doctor to Congress and Supreme Court Toils to Sidestep Politics Amid Pandemic
description: WASHINGTON When Senator John Barrasso, Republican of Wyoming, sought guidance on how to protect his family, including his 94-year-old father-in-law, when he returned home from the nations capital amid the coronavirus pandemic, a doctor offered him some blunt advice.

title: Peter Brancazio, Who Explored the Physics of Sports, Dies at 81
description: This obituary is part of a series about people who have died in the coronavirus pandemic. Read about others here.

title: 100 Babies Stranded in Ukraine After Surrogate Births
description: MOSCOW  The babies lie in cribs, sleeping, crying or smiling at nurses, swaddled in clean linens and apparently well cared for, but separated from their parents as an unintended consequence of coronavirus travel bans.

title: Burying My Bubby During the Pandemic
description: One Sunday afternoon a month ago, my mother put me on a conference call with a nurse who explained exactly how we were going to say goodbye to my grandmother, Bubby. She was dying of the coronavirus.

title: David Carter, a Historian of Stonewall, Is Dead at 67
description: David Carter, whose careful research into the Stonewall Inn uprising of 1969, a pivotal event in gay rights history, culminated in an authoritative book on the subject and helped win the area in Greenwich Village where the episode occurred a listing in the National Register of Historic Places, died on May 1 at his home in Manhattan. He was 67.

title: Justin Amash Abandons Third-Party Presidential Bid
description: Representative Justin Amash of Michigan announced on Saturday that he would not pursue the Libertarian Partys nomination for president, bringing an end to his extended flirtation with a third-party candidacy that could have introduced a new element of uncertainty into the race between President Trump and former Vice President Joseph R. Biden Jr.

title: Read the Full Transcript of Obamas H.B.C.U. Commencement Speech
description: Former President Barack Obama gave the virtual commencement address at a ceremony for graduates of historically black colleges and universities on Saturday. The two-hour event, Show Me Your Walk H.B.C.U. Edition, celebrated more than 27,000 students from 78 schools.

title: Exotic Lizards Creep Into Georgia. Dont Expect Southern Hospitality.
description: Add it to the list of terrors of the natural world  including murder hornets and feral hogs  that have been disrupting life these days: The Argentine black and white tegu, an invasive lizard species from South America, has taken root in Georgia, where it poses a threat to native wildlife, according to state officials.

title: Trump Ousted State Dept. Watchdog at Pompeos Urging; Democrats Open Inquiry
description: WASHINGTON  Secretary of State Mike Pompeo urged President Trump to fire the official responsible for fighting waste and fraud in his department, a White House official said Saturday, a recommendation certain to come under scrutiny after congressional Democrats opened an investigation into what they said may be an act of illegal retaliation.

title: Fred Willard, Who Played Characters Gloriously Out of Their Depth, Dies at 86
description: Fred Willard, the Emmy Award-nominated comic actor best known for his scene-stealing roles in Christopher Guests improvised ensemble film comedies like Best in Show and Waiting for Guffman and on sitcoms like Modern Family and Everybody Loves Raymond, died on Friday at his home in Los Angeles. He was 86.

title: Astrid Kirchherr, Who Helped Create the Beatles Image, Dies at 81
description: Astrid Kirchherr, the German photographer whose portraits of the Beatles when the musicians were a scruffy British bar band playing in Hamburgs red-light district captured not only their toughness but also the sensitivity beneath their leather-clad exteriors, died on Tuesday in Hamburg, Germany. She was 81.

title: Cody Latimer of Washington Redskins Faces Assault and Weapons Charges
description: Cody Latimer, the Washington Redskins wide receiver formerly of the New York Giants, was arrested early on Saturday in Colorado on assault and weapons charges, local officials said.

title: Donald Trump Jr. Smears Biden With Baseless Instagram Post
description: WASHINGTON  President Trumps eldest son on Saturday posted a social media message suggesting Joseph R. Biden Jr. was a pedophile, an incendiary and baseless charge that illustrates the tactics the president is turning to as he attempts to erase Mr. Bidens early advantage in key state polls.

title: F.D.A. Clears Another Coronavirus Testing Kit for Use at Home
description: The Food and Drug Administration on Saturday granted emergency clearance for a coronavirus testing kit that will enable individuals to take a nasal sample at home and send it to a laboratory for diagnostic testing, the second such approval it has made.

title: Wide-Open Spaces
description: SUNDAY PUZZLE  We are fast approaching Byron Waldens 100th puzzle for The Times, and hes prolific elsewhere (including the American Crossword Puzzle Tournament). I think todays construction is an escalation in the unthemed Sunday crossword monster construction race, as it has only 122 entries, tied with a beast from last year by Frank Longo (fewer answers make puzzles tougher to solve and absolute bears to build, as a rule). As its title intimates, this grid also has 177 open squares, which are empty squares that dont touch any black block, even diagonally, third only to a 218 Patrick Berry Sunday puzzle and the aforementioned Longo puzzle. Joel Fagliano has made a 124-answer Sunday puzzle in the last year as well; all of these have been unthemed. Perhaps one day well get a collaboration between all of these constructors with 42 spans and no black squares at all, and someone will still drop a too easy! in the comments.

title: Lynn Shelton, Director of Intimate Comic Dramas, Dies at 54
description: Lynn Shelton, the acclaimed director of Humpday, Sword of Trust and numerous other independent films, died on Friday at a hospital in Los Angeles. She was 54.

title: Lynn Shelton Movie Moments
description: The writer and director Lynn Shelton, who in the last decade emerged as a strong voice in contemporary American independent film, has died at the age of 54. Her films often captured regular people facing irregular or extraordinary, scenarios that forced them to view their lives differently. Here is a look at highlights from her filmography, including review excerpts and information on where you can stream the movies.

title: Phyllis George, Trailblazing Sportscaster, Is Dead at 70
description: Phyllis George, who achieved one level of fame as Miss America 1971 and another one four years later, when CBS hired her to join the otherwise all-male cast of The NFL Today, died on Thursday in Lexington, Ky. She was 70.

title: Glitches in Online A.P. Tests Add to Students Anxieties
description: Julia Rock-Torcivia had everything in place for her Advanced Placement chemistry test.

title: Read the Full Transcript of Obamas High School Commencement Speech
description: Former President Barack Obama spoke Saturday at Graduate Together: High School Class of 2020 Commencement, an event organized by XQ Institute, a think tank that works with schools, in partnership with LeBron Jamess foundation and the Entertainment Industry Foundation.

title: Corrections: May 17, 2020
description: An article on Page 13 about the TNT series Snowpiercer misstates the class status of Andre Layton, the character played by Daveed Diggs. Layton is a member of the bottom class, known as tailies, not the third class, which is higher.

title: Quotation of the Day: I Cant Turn My Brain Off
description: The virus scares the hell out of our guys. And now, when they go home to decompress, instead they and their spouses are home-schooling. The spouse has lost a job, and is at wits end. The kids are screaming. Let me tell you: The tension level in the crews is through the roof.

title: Where New Yorkers Moved to Escape Coronavirus
description: As some of New York's wealthiest neighborhoods emptied out, mail-forwarding requests show us where they went.

title: Ahmaud Arberys Final Minutes: What Videos and 911 Calls Show
description: Using security footage, cellphone video, 911 calls and police reports, The Times has reconstructed the 12 minutes before Ahmaud Arbery was shot dead in Georgia on Feb. 23.

title: Where Ahmaud Arbery Ran, Neighbors Cast Wary Eyes
description: BRUNSWICK, Ga.  For many residents of Satilla Shores, a subdivision in coastal Georgia, their waterfront neighborhood is paradise without pretension.

title: At Least 12 Firefighters Injured After Explosion in Downtown Los Angeles
description: LOS ANGELES  The firefighters realized something was wrong inside the building in downtown Los Angeles on Saturday night.

title: Kathy Su, Eric Schultz
description: Kathy Su and Eric Paul Schultz were married May 16 in Mesa, Ariz. Wade R. Swanson, a cousin of the groom and a Universal Life minister, officiated in the backyard of his home.

title: Ayelet Bentley, Samuel Tbeile
description: Ayelet Meryl Bentley and Samuel Joshua Tbeile are to be married May 17. Rabbi Meyer Laniado is to officiate at the Wadsworth Mansion in Middletown, Conn.

title: Nigerian Coronavirus Outbreak Highlights Emerging Threat in Africa
description: This briefing has ended. Follow live global updates on the coronavirus here.

title: Whats on TV Sunday: Snowpiercer and Taylor Swift
description: SNOWPIERCER 9 p.m. on TNT. Jennifer Connelly and Daveed Diggs star in this postapocalyptic drama series, based on the action flick of the same name by the director Bong Joon Ho (Parasite) and its source material, the French graphic novel series Le Transperceneige. The title refers to the shows setting: a 1,001-car train that continuously circles the Earth after the planet has frozen and become unlivable. Yet worldly evils remain, namely class divides, social injustice and greed. Tensions reach a fever pitch when someone is killed in first class and Melanie Cavill (Connelly), the head of hospitality, seeks the help of Andre Layton (Diggs), a rebellious third-class passenger and the only surviving homicide detective on the planet. The series has been five years in the making, buts its debut comes two weeks earlier than planned. And TNT has already ordered a second season.

title: I Must Present a Compelling Case for Keeping the Item in Question
description: Dear Diary:

title: How France Lost the Weapons to Fight a Pandemic
description: PARIS  When President Emmanuel Macron repeatedly declared war on the coronavirus in March, he solemnly promised that France would support front-line health workers with the means, the protection.

title: Seeking: Big Democratic Ideas That Make Everything Better
description: More than 36 million Americans are suddenly unemployed. Congress has allocated $2.2 trillion in aid, with more likely to be on the way as a fight looms over government debt. Millions more people are losing their health insurance and struggling to take care of their children and aging relatives. And nearly 90,000 are dead in a continuing public health catastrophe.

title: Chinese Ambassador Is Found Dead at Home in Israel
description: JERUSALEM  Chinas ambassador to Israel, who took up his post in February, was found dead at his home on Sunday morning in a coastal suburb north of Tel Aviv, officials said.

title: Wandering a Grand Hotel Emptied by Coronavirus, and Checking 1,400 Taps
description: BARCELONA, Spain  Every five days, Daniel Ordoez opens 1,400 pipe taps in a waterfront hotel here in Barcelona that locals call The Sail because of its shape.

title: Without Fans, Some College Football Games Wont Make Financial Sense
description: When Alabama and Southern California agreed to kick off the season on Sept. 5 in Arlington, Texas, the one certain winner seemed to be the host  the Dallas Cowboys owner, Jerry Jones, whose Labor Day weekend game has become a college football staple.

title: Will Cirque du Soleil Rise Again?
description: MONTREAL  Until the coronavirus pandemic hit, the Mongolian contortionist Uranbileg Angarag wowed spectators nightly at Cirque du Soleil shows on a cruise ship, contorting her body into a ball and balancing on a vertical stick held in her mouth.

title: Homes That Sold for Around $750,000
description: Each week, our survey of recent residential sales in New York City and the surrounding region focuses on homes that sold around a certain price point, allowing you to compare single-family homes, condos and co-ops in different locales.

title: Oil Prices Are Coming Back as Demand Rises
description: HOUSTON  Driving in the United States and Europe is picking up a little. Refineries in China are buying more oil as that countrys economy reopens. Saudi Arabia and Russia ended their price war and slashed production, and American oil companies are decommissioning rigs and shutting wells.

title: One More Relationship Tested by the Pandemic: Siblings
description: The isolation and close quarters of self-quarantine have shifted the balance in relationships between spouses and partners, employees and bosses, children and parents, students and teachers.

title: In the Shadows of Americas Smokestacks, Virus Is One More Deadly Risk
description: This isnt the first time Vicki Dobbinss town has been forced to shelter in place.

title: State of the Virus, Barack Obama, Baseball: Your Weekend Briefing
description: (Want to get this briefing by email? Heres the sign-up.)

title: Illinois Shooting Suspect Found Dead After Standoff at Super 8 Motel
description: A burst of violence on Sunday morning at a Super 8 motel in Northern Illinois ended with one person killed, two others wounded and a suspect who was barricaded for hours inside the building dead of what appeared to be a self-inflicted gunshot wound, the authorities said.

title: The Week in Business: Ready or Not, Here Comes the Reopening
description: What letter will the economic recovery resemble? Everyone wants it to be a V  after a precipitous fall, straight up from here. But more realistic forecasters warn that itll likely be a long, wide U, taking years to rebuild. Scarier yet, some health officials say that we could see a W if the country reopens too early and theres a resurgence of cases. Heres the rest of the business news you need to know for the week ahead.

title: As Cable TV Fades, Fearing the End of Comedy Central
description: Last year there were signs of hope for Comedy Central. Trevor Noah, the host of The Daily Show since 2015, had found his footing. New series like The Other Two and South Side got strong reviews. Awkwafina, the breakout star of Crazy Rich Asians and The Farewell, came aboard for a new show.

title: Afghan Rivals Sign Power-Sharing Deal as Political Crisis Subsides
description: KABUL, Afghanistan  Afghanistans monthslong election dispute, which resulted in the bizarre reality of two men taking the oath of office as president, reached a resolution on Sunday when President Ashraf Ghani gave his chief rival, Abdullah Abdullah, the leading role in the countrys peace process with the Taliban and the right to appoint half the cabinet.

title: Ill Take Bidens Confusion Over Trumps Corruption
description: Please tell me why I should care whether Joe Biden is declining mentally when Donald Trump bottomed out morally long ago.

title: Illinois Threatens to Fine Defiant Businesses as Reopening Tensions Rise Nationally
description: This briefing has ended. Follow our latest coverage of the coronavirus pandemic.

title: Cuomo Urges More New Yorkers to Get Tested for Coronavirus
description: [This briefing has ended. For the latest updates on the coronavirus outbreak in the New York area, read Mondays live coverage.]

title: The Sunday Read: Letters of Recommendation
description: Listen and subscribe to our podcast from your mobile device:Via Apple Podcasts | Via Spotify | Via Stitcher

title: Arthur, the First Named Storm of the Hurricane Season, Forms
description: The first named storm of the Atlantic hurricane season  formed off the coast of Florida over the weekend and approached North Carolina, making this the sixth consecutive year that a system formed before the official June 1 start of the season, the National Hurricane Center said.

title: The Museum Is Closed, but Its Tomato Man Soldiers On
description: The halls of the Guggenheim Museum are pretty quiet these days, with mostly just its ghosts and some security guards as company for the art.

title: What to Cook This Week
description: Good morning. There was a great moment the other day as I was driving down to the market for supplies, a rare traffic jam on a stretch of road thats generally barren, cars backed up in both directions so that a family of Canada geese could waddle across the road, moving from a pond on one side to the bay on the other. The mother goose had her neck stretched low to the pavement, guiding the goslings along, and if Michael the police officer wasnt there with his whistle to help, it was still reminiscent of Robert McCloskeys Make Way for Ducklings, and I knew every driver in line was smiling behind her mask.

title: Ending Crisis, Israel Swears in Netanyahu-Led Government to Rescue Economy
description: JERUSALEM  Ending a 510-day political crisis that three elections had failed to resolve, Israel on Sunday swore in a new government charged with responding to the coronavirus pandemic, extending Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahus record-setting tenure just a week before his corruption trial is set to begin.

title: Covid-19 Outbreak in Nigeria Is Just One of Africas Alarming Hot Spots
description: DAKAR, Senegal  In the northern Nigerian city of Kano, some people say they now get four or five death notices on their phones each day: A colleague has died. A friends aunt. A former classmate.

title: How Democrats Win in My Red State (and They Do Win)
description: BOZEMAN, Mont.  The only reason to be a Democrat running for statewide office in Montana is that, alas, you are one. Just keep in mind that there will be none of that heady, audacity-of-hope-type jazz. In this cold, conservative state, your mission is to persuade the skeptics east of the Rocky Mountain Front that you are a levelheaded, friendly, capitalist adult who wont be levitating the Pentagon  a task that has gotten considerably easier since the Republican establishment lost interest in basic empiricism.

title: The Silver Lining of Being Quarantined During Ramadan
description: When Gov. Andrew Cuomo of New York announced that lockdown would be extended through May 15, I wondered how this would affect Ramadan. After all, dinner parties and communal prayers have long been integral to this month, which began on April 24. But rather unexpectedly, quarantine has enhanced my Ramadan experience. Being at home has made it easier to observe our holiest month and made it a richer and deeper spiritual affair.

title: Whats Behind the Nursing Home Horror
description: We knew it from the beginning. A nursing home in Washington State was the center of the first known coronavirus outbreak in the United States. We knew that institutions caring for the elderly and disabled in close quarters would be particularly vulnerable during the pandemic.

title: How Many Covid Deaths? Dont Ask President Trump
description: The fatality numbers are, to be sure, heartbreaking: more than 85,000 Americans dead and more than 1.4 million infected. But many public health experts, including some within the Trump administration, have been stressing that, if anything, Covid-19 deaths and cases are being undercounted.

title: Fathers, Sons, Forgiveness and Regrets
description: To the Editor:

title: To the Class of 2020
description: To the Editor:

title: Autoworkers Are Returning as Carmakers Gradually Crank Up Factories
description: After sheltering at home for nearly two months, tens of thousands of autoworkers have started streaming back into car and truck plants across the South and Midwest, a critical step toward bringing the nations largest manufacturing industry back to life.

title: Fed Chair Says Economic Recovery May Stretch Through End of 2021
description: Jerome H. Powell, the Federal Reserve chair, said that the United States would have a slow recovery from what he called the biggest shock that the economys had in living memory, suggesting that a full rebound from virus-induced lockdowns could take until the end of 2021.

title: Black Deliveryman Says He Was Blocked and Interrogated by White Driver
description: Travis Miller Sr., an appliance and furniture deliveryman, had just completed his eighth and last delivery of the day last Monday and was attempting to leave a gated community with a co-worker when a white car blocked his path to the neighborhoods only exit.

title: Immigration Agency That Issues Visas, Green Cards Struggles to Stay Afloat
description: LOS ANGELES  A precipitous drop in applications for green cards, citizenship and other programs has threatened the solvency of the federal agency that administers the countrys lawful immigration system, prompting it to seek a $1.2 billion cash infusion from Congress as well as fee hikes to stay afloat.

title: Moses Sumney and Perfume Genius: Complex Voices of Desire
description: Sexual desire is always complicated. Its a profoundly individual tangle of physical and psychological actions and responses, and its inseparable from flesh and circumstance, from instinct and memory and culture. It grows even more complex when those desires are seen as abnormal, outside the mainstream, unacceptable or even immoral  attitudes that an adolescent can internalize and an adult can struggle to outgrow.

title: A (Barely) Controlled Explosion, and 330 M.P.H. Before You Can Blink
description: At the head of a straight ribbon of pavement, a swarm of technicians and worker bees is attending to an odd contraption  a seeming cross between a car and the Batmobile. A brief, explosive show is about to thrill thousands watching from the grandstands.

title: A Generation Gap in Car Wax
description: Millennials dont love their cars the way their elders did, and if you make car wax, thats a problem.

title: My Cancer Doesnt Care About the Coronavirus
description: There is a checkpoint as you enter the Kimmel Cancer Center at Johns Hopkins Hospital in Baltimore, where I am being treated for cancer of the prostate and lymph nodes. With all but two sets of doors to the building locked shut, patients are corralled into an area roped off from the rest of the first-floor lobby. You are required to show your orange Hopkins patient identification card and proof that you have an appointment.

title: China Virus Cluster, Yemen, Cirque du Soleil: Your Monday Briefing
description: (Want to get this briefing by email? Heres the sign-up.)

title: Straight-Up Fire in His Veins: Teen Battles New Covid Syndrome
Why Driving in New York City Now Feels Post-Apocalyptic
description: A late morning drive down Fifth Avenue, starting at the Metropolitan Museum of Art, where the lanes are normally choked with inching traffic, now passes by almost impossibly quickly. Glance down at the speedometer, and you might miss Rockefeller Center.

title: Whats Going On in This Picture? | May 18, 2020
description: Note: This is our final photograph for the 2019-20 school year. Please visit our archive to find hundreds of other images you can use between now and September, when we will resume this feature. You can also sign up for our free weekly newsletter to make sure you dont miss any of our new images.

title: S. David Freeman, 94, Tireless Advocate for Clean Energy, Dies
description: S. David Freeman, a folksy but driven green cowboy who worked in energy policy under three presidents, ran some of the nations largest public utilities and pushed for renewable energy, died on Tuesday in Reston, Va. He was 94.

title: Shell Game
description: WORDPLAY, THE CROSSWORD COLUMN

title: Farewell, Office. You Were the Last Boundary Between Work and Home.
description: The office, for the foreseeable future, is dead. Google and Facebook are telling employees they can work remotely until 2021. Twitter is allowing employees to work from home forever. A number of big banks are contemplating never fully refilling their office towers in Manhattan. Last week, my colleague Matthew Haag wrote a thoroughly depressing story in which the chief executive of Halstead Real Estate asked him point blank: Looking forward, are people going to want to crowd into offices?

title: Trump Looks Forward to the Return of Sports With Crowds
description: In a telephone appearance during a televised charity golf exhibition on Sunday, President Trump enthusiastically supported the return of live sports events during the coronavirus pandemic.

title: As States Reopen, Governors Balance Existing Risks With New Ones
description: The pain of the coronavirus shutdown, in terms of wrecked economies and shattered lives, has been unmistakable. Now, governors across the country are contemplating the risks of reopening, particularly if it produces a surge of new cases and deaths.

title: Forty Years Later, Lessons for the Pandemic From Mount St. Helens
description: When I met David A. Johnston, it was on a spring evening, about a month before he would be erased from existence by a gigantic cloud of volcanic ash boiling over him at 300 miles per hour. He was coming through the door of a makeshift command center in Vancouver, Wash., the closest city to the graceful snow-capped dome of Mount St. Helens, a volcano that had been dormant for 123 years. This was April 1980, and Mr. Johnston, a 30-year-old geologist, was one of the first scientists summoned to monitor new warning signs from the mountain  shallow earthquakes and periodic bursts of ash and steam.

title: Canadian Military Jet Crashes During Flyover for Coronavirus Workers, Killing One
description: A Canadian Air Force jet crashed, killing one of the military personnel on board, in Kamloops, British Columbia, on Sunday during a flyover that was intended as a tribute to Canadians, especially those on the front lines of the coronavirus pandemic, the authorities said.

title: 2 Kansas City Officers Charged With Assaulting Transgender Woman
description: Two Kansas City, Mo., police officers have been indicted on assault charges a year after they were caught on video using excessive force to arrest a transgender woman, prosecutors said.

title: Obama Lives in Trumps Head
description: No one irritates Donald Trump quite like Barack Obama.

title: Inspector Generals Firing Puts Pompeos Use of Taxpayer Funds Under Scrutiny
description: WASHINGTON  Secretary of State Mike Pompeo swatted away questions about his use of government resources again and again last year.

title: Is Ronan Farrow Too Good to Be True?
description: It was a breathtaking story, written by The New Yorkers marquee reporter and published with an attention-grabbing headline: Missing Files Motivated the Leak of Michael Cohens Financial Records.

title: Japan Falls Into Recession, and Worse Lies Ahead
description: Japan fell into a recession for the first time since 2015, as its already weakened economy was dragged down by the coronaviruss impact on businesses at home and abroad.

title: Fire Consumes Storefront in Harlem
description: New York firefighters battled a three-alarm blaze on Sunday night that started in a furniture store across the street from the Adam Clayton Powell Jr. State Office Building in Harlem, the authorities said.

title: Billions Season 5, Episode 3 Recap: Subjugate and Conquer
description: Billions is a show that seems to appreciate pro wrestling, as seen in the fandom of its dudebro character Mafee and the recent cameo by Becky Lynch. So I hope its not too indulgent to quote one of the great heel wrestlers, Ted DiBiase, better known as the Million Dollar Man, as a kind of epigraph for this episode: Everybodys got a price.

title: Quotation of the Day: Stuck Inside With Siblings, With Time to Bicker and Bond
description: Ezekiel, he is more than a handful. He is a school buss worth of handfuls.

title: No Corrections: May 18, 2020
description: No corrections appeared in print on Monday, May 18, 2020.

title: SoftBank in Crisis Amid Record Losses
description: TOKYO  His flagship tech fund is losing money. His company just posted billions in losses. And a key ally, the Chinese technology mogul Jack Ma, stepped aside.

title: Germany and France Propose $545 Billion Coronavirus Fund for Europe
description: Faced with economic calamity and the threat of the coronavirus further fracturing the European Union, Chancellor Angela Merkel of Germany on Monday broke with decades of German economic orthodoxy and agreed to back the idea of collective European debt to help those countries that have been hit hardest by the pandemic.

title: 14 Ways Were Finding Joy (in Spite of Everything)
description: These times are terrible. Why not read about a few things that aren't?

title: The Joy of Caring for Others
description: A month or so back, at the beginning of mask wearing out here in Bloomington, Ind., I was taking a walk and a friend pulled up in her little Toyota pickup truck. We chatted a bit from a distance (we usually hug, so many friends, so many beloveds we no longer touch, that touching being one of the ways we know each other, a sensorium bereft, and let us figure out how to mourn this properly), and then she told me she was on her way to drop off some masks shed made for her nephew, whos about my age, at the jail.

title: The Joy of Perfecting the Sexy Selfie
description: In a memorable episode of 30 Rock, Tracy Jordan says: Im just going through the classic stages of grief: fear, denial, horniness, wisdom, sleepiness and now depression. My therapist really had done his very best to explain to me that the collective loss of normalcy we were all experiencing was rooted in grief, but nothing  absolutely nothing  prepared me for the horniness.

title: The Joy of Looking at the Lives of Strangers
description: Im in Dakar, Senegal. I havent left the house since Feb. 27. The airport isnt expected to reopen until May 31. Not that Ill know where to go once it does, and if Ill have to remain inside for two weeks once I get there.

title: The Joy of Imaginary Homesteading in Los Angeles
description: Yesterday, my husband found a large baby bird in our yard. It was the size of a cantaloupe and had gray wings with tendrils of yellow fuzz sticking out of them. Someone online said we should keep it hydrated, so I went outside with a dropper and a jar of water, expecting it to be afraid of me.

title: The Joy of Consuming an Obscene Number of Calories Before Noon
description: Im not, traditionally, a breakfast person. I can house a fry-up, but only when the occasion calls for it  say, hypothetically, an extra drink or six the night before  and, sure, Ill dip into the pastry basket at a free hotel breakfast buffet, but generally less for nutrition than for the more sustaining satisfaction of maximizing the value of my hotel room.

title: The Joy of a Junky Old Nintendo
description: One evening, a few weeks ago, at 8 p.m., my husband and I put our young daughter to bed as usual. At 8:01 p.m., I was scheduled to begin the crying hour, in which I burst into tears from the stress and headlines and death toll stats of the day.

title: The Joy of Deleting My Many Mediocre Photos
description: I wear the chain I forged in life, the ghost of Jacob Marley once complained to a former co-worker. I made it link by link, and yard by yard. I know exactly what he was talking about  I have several thousand mediocre to wretched photos saved on my smartphone, and I carry them with me at all times.

title: The Joy of Regrowing My Scallions  Yes, Regrowing My Scallions
description: One night, after making this terrifically simple Melissa Clark ginger-scallion chicken dish for dinner, I eyed the leftover hairy scallion butts, laying discarded near the cutting board. On a whim, I arranged them roots-down in a jelly jar with a little bit of water. By the next morning, they were happily back on their way, a tender, alive thing, stretching toward the light.

title: The Joy of Getting Lost and Finding Your Way
description: Im not so unusual: I have Google calendar to remind me where Im supposed to be at any given hour of any given day, Google maps to tell me how to get there, and Google notifications to pester me, so I dont show up late.

title: The Joy of Jogging Very, Very Slowly
description: We were knee-deep in quarantine and the television was on. Andrew Cuomo is talking about running! I shrieked excitedly to my husband.

title: The Joy of Having Plans Cancel Themselves
description: We isolated as a family a full 10 days before others; one of my sons has asthma, and it was clear we werent getting good information  Sure! Masks wont help prevent a respiratory illness! Sure! We became like Pompeii, frozen in place in a house in the suburbs that Id longed to leave until all of this happened. Now, were left to find the smaller things that give us joy, and Im not finding much. Also, my 9-year-old? He hums all the time, it turns out. All. The. Time.

title: The Joy of the Hate-Watch
description: The Princess Bride debuted on my 18th birthday  Sept. 25, 1987  but did not find its way onto my radar until 10 years later, when suddenly everyone was running around saying, I am Inigo Montoya. You killed my father. Prepare to die.

title: The Joy of Circling the Block
Coronavirus Clusters, Latin America, Sweden: Your Monday Briefing
description: (Want to get this briefing by email? Heres the sign-up.)

title: The Joy of Picking a Fight With Friends
description: Anyone for Zoom Uno? I suggested to a group chat. Maybe Friday night?

title: Stocks Surge as Oil Prices Rally
description: Many of the worlds economies have begun to loosen restrictions on commerce, the Federal Reserve chair on Sunday signaled that the central bank has more firepower to lend to recovery efforts, and a drugmaker reported positive developments in an early trial of a coronavirus vaccine.

title: Whats on TV Monday: Big Flower Fight and Dead Still
description: BIG FLOWER FIGHT Stream on Netflix. The title says it all. In this new series, 10 pairs of amateur floral designers fight it out to see who can come up with the most beautiful and behemoth botanical sculptures. As in similar shows, the contestants receive challenges that test their skills, ingenuity and ability to work under pressure. Winners are awarded the best in bloom honor while losers are plucked away like weeds. The creations  which need to combine architectural integrity, horticultural acumen and visual appeal  are judged by Kristen Griffith-VanderYacht, a floral designer to the stars, and guest experts. The comedian Vic Reeves and the actress Natasia Demetriou host the proceedings.

title: Germany Is Reopening. And Learning a Tough Lesson.
description: BERLIN  In its handling of the coronavirus, Germany has been something of a model, alternately admired and envied across the world.

title: The Joy of Working on a Project About Joy
description: Times Insider explains who we are and what we do, and delivers behind-the-scenes insights into how our journalism comes together.

title: Hong Kong Legislators Brawl Amid Fears Over Widening Chinese Control
description: HONG KONG  Scuffles erupted Monday between lawmakers in Hong Kong as they debated the leadership of a committee that is to consider legislation that pro-democracy politicians fear would tighten Chinas control over the semiautonomous territory.

title: Word + Quiz: corpus
This Is What Watching Sports Looks Like Now
description: As soon as you leave Dortmunds central station, you see the black and yellow. Decked out in the teams luminous colors, Borussia Dortmunds club shop draws the eye from across the square.

title: Did the Coronavirus Kill Ideology in Australia?
description: HOBART, Australia  Until four months ago few leaders seemed more influenced  even inspired  by President Trumps worldview than Australias prime minister, Scott Morrison.

title: Passed By for Decades, Clarence Thomas Is a New Symbol of the Trump Era
